name: 100.1 - Method Statement Development / Job Safety & Environmental Analysis

Detail of Activity: Prepare shared services trench construction methodology and Job Safety & Environmental Analysis suitable for site (eg access, working areas, proximity to slopes, traffic and other site hazards, construction stages proposed)
Acceptance Criteria: Method Statement and JSEA Completed and signed by relevant authority.
Comments: Method Statement and Job Safety & Environmental Analysis to be provided to Engineer for review prior to commencing excavation on site.
Detail of Activity: Check drawings are for construction and latest revision. Check Specification is for construction and latest revision
Acceptance Criteria: Drawings and Specification are the latest revision.
Record documents: IFC Drawings and Specification
Comments: Up to date drawings and specification to be reviewed before construction.
Detail of Activity: Power, Telecommunications and Gas ducting / piping to be provided by the service provider.
Acceptance Criteria: All ducting / piping is to be provided by service provider
Comments: Ensure ducts are ordered and being delivered when needed
Detail of Activity: Service pits / chambers to be provided by the service provider.
Acceptance Criteria: All service pits / chambers are to be provided by service provider
Comments: Ensure service pits / chambers are ordered and being delivered when needed
Detail of Activity: Warning tape / mag slabs to be provided by service provider
Acceptance Criteria: Warning tape / mag slabs to be provided by service provider
Detail of Activity: GPS Setout of the shared services trench location as per the construction drawings.
Minimum Test Frequency: All shared trenches.
Record documents: Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Comments: Setout location prior to commencing works.
100.7 - Sediment Controls are in place for the particular section
Detail of Activity: Check ESCP and ensure any controls needed are in place before excavation.
Minimum Test Frequency: once per section
Acceptance Criteria: Erosion and Sediment controls are in place prior to starting works.
Record documents: Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Detail of Activity: Confirm trench excavation is to the correct dimensions
Minimum Test Frequency: Every 20 lineal meters.
Inspection / Test method: Visual Inspection with tape measure.
Acceptance Criteria: Formation materials in accordance with design assumptions.
Record documents: Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Minimum Test Frequency: At the end of each day.
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure any open ends of ducts are temporarily capped to prevent ingress of dirt.
Record documents: Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Minimum Test Frequency: Every 20 lineal meters.
Inspection / Test method: Visual Inspection with tape measure & photo.
Acceptance Criteria: Check ducts are spaced as shown in the trench cross section.
Record documents: Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Detail of Activity: Good for purpose check
Minimum Test Frequency: Every 20 lineal meters.
Acceptance Criteria: Prove. (i.e. laid straight with no kinks, correctly connected, not squashed/damaged, clear of blockages and any materials such as dirt and cement)
Record documents: Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Detail of Activity: Protective Tape / Mag Slabs
Minimum Test Frequency: Every 20 lineal meters.
Acceptance Criteria: Placed in trench as indicated in drawings
Record documents: Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Minimum Test Frequency: Every 20 lineal meters.
Acceptance Criteria: Top of trench in berm. CIV ≥ 15.
Minimum Test Frequency: Every 20 lineal meters.
Inspection / Test method: Visual Inspection with tape measure & photo.
Record documents: Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Minimum Test Frequency: Every 20 lineal meters in pavement.
Acceptance Criteria: Scala 500mm deep. Target = 3 blows per 100mm.
Minimum Test Frequency: Every 20 lineal meters in pavement.
Acceptance Criteria: In road (granular) clegg every 300mm lift after thermal backfill. CIV ≥ 20.
Minimum Test Frequency: Every 20 lineal meters in pavement.
Acceptance Criteria: In road (granular) clegg every 300mm lift after thermal backfill. CIV ≥ 35.
Minimum Test Frequency: All filled trench surfaces
Acceptance Criteria: Left appropriate for temporary or permanent use (as applicable). I.E. temporary sealed, left flush or ramped with surrounding area and maintained.
Record documents: Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Acceptance Criteria: All above documentation is shown as attached to this work pack.
Minimum Test Frequency: At completion of construction
Asbuilts to be submitted at the completion of construction, information to be captured
Acceptance Criteria: Asbuilts reviewed and submitted
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with NZTA Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
